labels.analysis: The Gen-PDF Server specializes in converting markdown content, particularly GitHub Flavored Markdown, into professional-grade PDF documents. It offers advanced formatting features such as tables of contents, callouts, footnotes, code highlighting, and mathematical expressions. The tool is designed to enhance AI assistants by providing seamless PDF generation capabilities, making it suitable for documentation, reporting, and content presentation needs.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality of document generation aligns most closely with the "Content Creation" category, as it enables users to create polished PDFs from markdown. "Development Tools" is a secondary label due to its utility in code documentation and workflows involving AI assistants. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories cover the server's capabilities well.

tools.name: generate_pdf
tools.description: Generate a professional PDF document from markdown content using Gen-PDF. Supports advanced formatting, code highlighting, math expressions, tables, and customizable styling options including dark mode.

markdownDocument.description: Markdown content to convert to PDF

darkMode.description: Enable dark theme for the document

cover.description: Add a cover page to the PDF document that includes the title and subtitle date and a cover image

toc.description: Add a table of contents to the PDF document at the beginning of the document. You may want to add it if the document is long and you want to be able to navigate through it easily.

authors.description: Author of the document. They will be mention on the cover page, therefore this options is not needed if you do not use the cover page.

Generate professional PDF documents from markdown content with customizable styling options including dark mode and advanced page settings.

Convert any github flavored markdown to high-quality PDFs using the Gen-PDF API.

TOC
complex tables

Footnotes

Enhance AI assistants with seamless PDF creation capabilities.

tools.name: generate_pdf
tools.description: Generate a professional PDF document from markdown content using Gen-PDF. Supports advanced formatting, code highlighting, math expressions, tables, and customizable styling options including dark mode.

markdownDocument.description: Markdown content to convert to PDF

darkMode.description: Enable dark theme for the document

cover.description: Add a cover page to the PDF document that includes the title and subtitle date and a cover image

toc.description: Add a table of contents to the PDF document at the beginning of the document. You may want to add it if the document is long and you want to be able to navigate through it easily.

authors.description: Author of the document. They will be mention on the cover page, therefore this options is not needed if you do not use the cover page.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

config = {
  "debug": false
}
# Encode config in base64
config_b64 = base64.b64encode(json.dumps(config).encode()).decode()
smithery_api_key = ""

# Create server URL
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@gen-pdf/mcp/mcp?config={config_b64}&api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
